Region where the MRC is located
MRC Code
Village
Household number
Household ID
question.logic_check: hhid_verif <> hhid; 'This hhid does not match with the information you entered!'

question.text: Household enrolled in the survey?
If not enrolled, reason for exclusion?

responses.response: Unable to locate adult x 3 attempts
No Adult resident aged 18 or older present
Adult is not a usual resident, present on the previous night
Adult resident not willing to provide informed consent

question.text: What is the main source of drinking water for members of your household?
Specify other source of water
What kind of toilet facility do members of your household usually use?
Specify other kind of toilet facilities
What type of fuel does your household mainly use for cooking?
Specify other type of fuel used
What is the main source of energy for lighting in the household?
Specify other source of energy for lighting

Does your household have...
...Electricity?
...Radio?
…Television?
…Table?
…Chairs?
…Sofa set?
…Bed?
…Cupboard?

Does any member of your household own or have…
…Mobile phone?
….A bicycle?
…A motorcycle or motor scooter?
…A bank account?
…A device that can be used to access the internet?
Do you have a Smartphone that you can use to access internet?
Do you have a Tablet that you can use to access internet?
Do you have a laptop that you can use to access internet?
Do you have a desktop computer that you can use to access internet?

How many acres of agricultural land do members of this household own?
IF NONE, ENTER '0' IF 10,000 OR MORE, ENTER 10,000
How far is it to the nearest market place( in KM)?
Now I would like to ask you about the food your household eats. How many meals does your household usually have per day?
In the past week, on how many days did the household eat meat?
How often in the last year did you have problems in satisfying the food needs of the household?

How far is it to the nearest health facility?
If less than 1 km, enter 0 If more than 100 km, enter 100
If you were to go to this facility,how would you most likely go there?
What is the primary source of employment over the last 12 months for the main breadwinner or head of household?
Specify other primary source of Income
How much does the main bread winner/head of the household earn in UGX? Note: The question coming after, will ask about rates whether it is hourly, weekly, monthly or Annually
Indicate whether it is an hourly, weekly , monthly or annual rate
How much does your family typically spend on meals for one day? In UGX
Are there any other sources of income for your household (from other jobs, other household members who contribute to the household income)?
If yes, what is the approximate TOTAL amount of these other contributions per month? In UGX
How much does your household spend on the following every month? In UGX ….. Rent ( Eneter 0 if no expense made on rent)
…. Food
…. Transportation ( Enter 0 if no costs on transport)
…. Schoolfees( If fees is paid per term, divide the amount by 3 to monthly expense)
…. Medical Insurance( If no expense on insurance, enter 0 (Zero))
…. Clothing(Get total amount used to buy clothes in the year, divide by 12 months)
At any time in the past 12 months, has anyone asked permission to come into your dwelling to spray the interior walls against mosquitoes?
Did you grant them permission to spray the interior walls of your dwelling?

What was the primary reason that you did not grant permission to spray the interior walls of your dwelling against mosquitoes?
DO NOT PROMPT.

responses.response: Someone in the house was pregnant

question.text:
How many months ago was the dwelling last sprayed?
If less than 1 month, enter 0
Who sponsored the spraying of the interior walls of your dwelling against mosquitoes?
Has Seasonal Malaria Chemoprevention(SMC) been given in this MRC target area?
Does your household have any mosquito nets that can be used while sleeping?

Bednets were distributed in your community between November to Dec 2023 (programmed to know MRC date of distribution) Did you receive one or more bednets in the recent net campaign (Universal Coverage Campaign) led by the Ministry of Health?
If yes – How many nets did you receive?
How many nets from the campaign do you still have?
question.logic_check: manynow > manynet; 'You cannot have more nets than you received!'

question.text: What type of nets did you receive
Please specify other net type
Did you receive any education on how to hang (or use) the bednets prior to or during distribution?
If no, why did you not receive nets?

responses.response: No nets were delivered to the area (village or parish)
We did not go to collect the nets
We were never told to collect the nets
We were told our household did not need nets
We were away when the nets were distributed
The local leaders refused to accept the nets
I had no National Identity Card
Our household was not registered for nets

question.text: Please specify other reason
Is there a community health worker (community medicine distributor/CMD, village health team/VHT, community own resource person/CORP) who distributes malaria medicines in your village or community?
Does the community health worker currently have malaria medicines available?
In the last two weeks, has anyone received care from a Community Health Worker?
Has any member in this household received malaria vaccine
QUESTIONS TO THE CARE GIVER At your last visit to get the malaria vaccine, where did you seek immunization services?
Specify other
Specify health facility
Outreaches (specify village)
Integrated Child Health Days (specify which month and year)
During your last visit to get the malaria vaccine, how much time did you spend at the health facility or outreach? Days ( Enter 0 if time spent is less than 1 day)
Specify time in hours ( Enter 0 if time spent is less than an hour)
Specify time in minutes(This field should not be left empty, if no minutes spent, enter 0)
Did anyone travel with you /visit you at the clinic?
Who did you travel with or visited you at the clinic?
Specify the other person you traveled with to the clinic
What is his/her occupation?
Specify other care givers occupation
Did the person accompanying you spend the same amount of time?
If "NO”, how much time? In Days
Specify time in hours
Specify time in minutes
Apart from travel costs, did you use any money at the clinic or due to the visit? (this includes her/his, the person accompanying/visiting etc, but not travel costs)
How much money did you spend on each of the following: (in Ugandan Shillings , Enter 0 if no amount was spent) Registration book
Child health card
Food/drink
Under-the-table payment
Gift for health worker
Other laboratory tests
Specify other Laboratory tests
If she/he doesn't know details, ask her to give her best estimate of the total she/he spent at the last visit:
Did you have travel costs to the clinic?
How much money did you spend in total on travel to the clinic (this includes person accompanying and child)?
What mode of transport did you use to the clinic?
How much time did you spend travelling to the clinic
State the number of hours
State the number of minutes
Did your child receive the R21 vaccine?
If Yes to receiving the R21 vaccine, How many doses have they received so far? One dose, Two doses, Three doses, Four doses.
In the year before your child received the malaria vaccine, how many times did your child have malaria?
Since your child received the malaria vaccine, how many times has your child had malaria?
Think about the most recent malaria episode after vaccination, how much did you spend on?( Enter 0 if no amount was spent) Consultation
Expense on laboratory
Expense on medicines
Expense on admission
Expense on food/drink
Expense on transport
other expenses
How many days did you miss work or usual activities during your child’s last episode of malaria?
How much income did you lose during these days?
Compared to before receiving the vaccine, do you spend more, less, or about the same on malaria treatment now?
Has the number of malaria episodes reduced since vaccination?
Has the malaria vaccine helped reduce missed workdays for you?
If the child did not receive the R21 vaccine, In the last year, how many times has your child had malaria?
During the last malaria episode for your child, how much did you spend on? Consultation
Expense on laboratory
Expense on medicines
Expense on admission
Expense on food/drink
Expense on transport
other expenses
How many days did you miss work or usual activities during your child’s last episode of malaria?
How much income did you lose during these days?
How many structures in your household have rooms used for sleeping?
How many people live in this household (permanent residents)?
How many bednets do you currently have in your household?
question.logic_check: nnets < manynow; 'You cannot have current total nets less than those both you currently have from the campaign and other sources. Current bednets in the household include total available nets from the campaign and nets obtained from other sources!'
